help_description: The short name of the sample.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal >20 and <4800. This usually indicates poor tissue detection, poor library quality, or poor sequencing quality. Application performance is likely to be affected.
alert_warn_detail_cs: Ideal > 20 and < 4800. This usually indicates poor tissue detection, poor library quality, or poor sequencing quality. Application performance is likely to be affected.
help_description: The number of barcodes associated with a spot under tissue.
The total number of sequenced reads divided by the number of barcodes associated with a spot under tissue.
The median number of genes detected per spot under tissue-associated barcode. Detection is defined as the presence of at least 1 UMI count.
Total number of read pairs that were assigned to this library in demultiplexing.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 75%. This may indicate a quality issue with the Illumina R1 read for the Visium v1 Chemistry. Application performance may be affected.
help_description: Fraction of reads with barcodes that match the whitelist after barcode correction.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 75%. This may indicate a quality issue with the Illumina R1 read for the Visium v1 Chemistry. Application performance may be affected.
help_description: Fraction of reads with valid UMIs; i.e. UMI sequences that do not contain Ns and that are not homopolymers.
The total number of sequenced reads divided by the number of barcodes associated with spot under tissue

The fraction of reads originating from an already-observed UMI. This is a function of library complexity and sequencing depth. More specifically, this is the fraction of confidently mapped, valid spot-barcode, valid UMI reads that had a non-unique (spot-barcode, UMI, gene).

alert_warn_detail: Fraction of spot barcode bases with Q-score >= 30 should be above 80%. A lower fraction might indicate poor sequencing quality.
alert_warn_name: Fraction of spot barcode bases with Q-score >= 30 is low
help_description: Fraction of spot barcode bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.

alert_warn_detail: Fraction of RNA read bases with Q-score >= 30 should be above 80%. A lower fraction might indicate poor sequencing quality.
alert_warn_name: Fraction of RNA read bases with Q-score >= 30 is low
help_description: Fraction of RNA read bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator. This is Read 2 for the Visium v1 chemistry.

alert_warn_detail: Fraction of UMI bases with Q-score >= 30 should be above 80%. A lower fraction might indicate poor sequencing quality.
alert_warn_name: Fraction of UMI bases with Q-score >= 30 is low
help_description: Fraction of UMI bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.
Fraction of reads that mapped to the genome.
Fraction of reads that mapped uniquely to the genome. If a gene mapped to exonic loci from a single gene and also to non-exonic loci, it is considered uniquely mapped to one of the exonic loci.

full_name: Reads Mapped Confidently to Intergenic Regions
help_description: Fraction of reads that mapped uniquely to an intergenic region of the genome.

full_name: Reads Mapped Confidently to Intronic Regions
help_description: Fraction of reads that mapped uniquely to an intronic region of the genome.

full_name: Reads Mapped Confidently to Exonic Regions
help_description: Fraction of reads that mapped uniquely to an exonic region of the genome.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 30%. This can indicate use of the wrong reference transcriptome, a reference transcriptome with overlapping genes, poor library quality, poor sequencing quality, or reads shorter than the recommended minimum. Application performance may be affected.
alert_warn_name: Low Fraction Reads Confidently Mapped To Transcriptome
help_description: Fraction of reads that mapped to a unique gene in the transcriptome. The read must be consistent with annotated splice junctions. These reads are considered for UMI counting.

full_name: Reads Mapped Confidently to On-Target Transcriptome
alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 30%. This can indicate use of the wrong reference transcriptome, a reference transcriptome with overlapping genes, poor library quality, poor sequencing quality, or reads shorter than the recommended minimum. Application performance may be affected.
alert_warn_name: Low Fraction Reads Confidently Mapped To On-Target Transcriptome
help_description: Fraction of reads that mapped to a unique gene in the on-target transcriptome. The read must be consistent with annotated splice junctions. These reads are considered for on target UMI counting.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal < 10%. This can indicate use of an unsupported chemistry type (e.g. using Single Cell V(D)J for gene counting). Application performance is likely to be affected.
alert_warn_name: High Fraction of Reads Mapped Antisense to Genes
help_description: Fraction of reads confidently mapped to the transcriptome, but on the opposite strand of their annotated gene. A read is counted as antisense if it has any alignments that are consistent with an exon of a transcript but antisense to it, and has no sense alignments.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 20 and < 4800. This usually indicates poor tissue detection, poor library quality, or poor sequencing quality. Application performance is likely to be affected.
alert_warn_detail_cs: Ideal > 20 and < 4800. This usually indicates poor tissue detection, poor library quality, or poor sequencing quality. Application performance is likely to be affected.
help_description: The number of barcodes associated with a spot under tissue.

full_name: Fraction Reads in Spots Under Tissue
alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 50%. Application performance may be affected. Many of the reads were not assigned to tissue covered spots. This could be caused by high levels of ambient RNA resulting from inefficient permeabilization or because of poor tissue detection. The latter case can be addressed by using the manual tissue selection option through Loupe.
help_description: The fraction of valid-barcode, confidently-mapped-to-transcriptome reads with spot-associated barcodes.
The number of genes with at least one UMI count in any tissue covered spot.
The median number of UMI counts per tissue covered spot.
The fraction of the spots under the tissue.

alert_warn_detail: Inspect the image alignment for possible errors
help_description: full_name
